Whitefish, Montana is a place to make lifelong friends. In this episode of the Montana Way, Amie Engerbretson speaks‚Äîand skis‚Äîwith two locals who embody that spirit.
Paid Partnership with @VisitMontana #MontanaMoment

Find out why @nordicaski is changing the most trusted ski line in Episode 3 of ‚ÄúCrafted.‚Äù This chapter isn‚Äôt just about ski design; it‚Äôs about how personalities and ideas make great products even better. 
For 2021, Nordica replaces the Enforcer 93 with an all-new Enforcer 94; and, for the first time since it‚Äôs inception, redesigns the Enforcer 100 as a more playful performance model. Watch the full episode at the link bio. #powderproductions

Step up your Dew Tour Copper Mountain experience with a VIP pass! Space is limited, so get your VIP pass online at dewtour.com before they are gone! @coppermtn  @woodwardcopper  @teamtoyota

"My mom used to make tuna sandwiches. No cheese, no lettuce, nothing fancy or crunchy mixed in. Just tuna, salt, pepper, and mayo spread between two slices of white.
We‚Äôd make the long drive through the dark morning to Vermont, gear up in the lodge, and eventually stuff the duffel, our lunches enclosed, in a cubby or secluded corner until it was rescued midway through our ski day." Read former Powder editor Derek Taylor's ode to the brown bag lunch on Powder.com
#PowderToThePeople

After duty as a Navy SEAL, Josh Jespersen came home and found comfort in long days outside in the mountains. As his connection solidified, so did his understanding of the threats to these landscapes, and his fight became one to protect wild places. His modus operandi is to continue showing up, whether that‚Äôs going to rallies, writing or speaking to government, or simply just taking someone outside.
See the full video on Powder.com
Paid Partnership with @patagonia

Located just 80 miles from Yellowstone, and situated between two ski areas, Bridger Bowl and Big Sky Resort, Bozeman is a winter mecca for outdoor adventure. Bozeman offers the ultimate winter playground, with everything from skiing to ice climbing and snowshoeing easily accessible from downtown. And with more than 300 days of sunshine on average each year, Bozeman winters are far from gloomy grey.
#onlyinbozeman
Paid Partnership with @visit_bozeman

We kicked off the 20th Annual Powder Awards with a prop-filled photo booth! Here are some highlights from the pre-party. Read the full list of winners, a recap of the night, and see some behind-the-scenes photos on Powder.com
#PowderToThePeople

Whitefish is for foodies. The town has everything you could want after a day on the mountain: fine dining, casual fare and even great sushi. The beer holds its own with some of Montana‚Äôs best, as well. Paid Partnership with @VisitMontana #MontanaMoment

Idling on the skin track, his face flushed with gusto and sunburn, Toby Yoder tells me about God. ‚ÄúWhen we‚Äôre up here, I feel we‚Äôre with Him,‚Äù he says. Behind us, rays of April sunlight pour down Kakache Peak‚Äôs northwest-facing couloirs, which harbor powder that hasn‚Äôt been touched once this winter.
Read the full Amish feature from the November (48.2) issue at the link in bio.
Photo: @krystlejwright 
#PowderToThePeople

POWDER Magazine celebrated the 20th Anniversary of the Powder Awards on Saturday, December 7 in front of a sold-out crowd at Hotel Jerome. Here are some photos of the night shot by @davidreddick. Read more about the night at the link in bio. Thanks to @10barrelbrewing, @aspensnowmass, @drinkhighwest, and @hoteljeromeaspen for their support!
#PowderToThePeople

@sage_cattabriga_alosa  pioneering a new perspective in the all new Smith Optics 4D Mag. Experience a Visual Revolution.
Paid partnership with @smithoptics

Standing tall at 11,053 feet, Mammoth is legendary for massive snowfall and one of the longest ski seasons in the country. This was no secret to Mammoth‚Äôs founder, Dave McCoy, who knew this from studying the landscape and weather patterns of the Eastern Sierra as a City of Los Angeles hydrographer.
Watch the full video on Powder.com
Partnership with @mammothmountain 
#PowderToThePeople

"To a North American, the Derby de La Meije doesn't even sound possible. It is an 800-person, 6,000-vertical-foot Chinese downhill (if that term still passes) through some of the gnarliest lift-accessed terrain in the world. It screams liability in bold, fluorescent letters. But France, bless its socialist heart, remains relatively free of the litigious constraints that frame modern American resort skiing. And La Grave is no resort." Want to learn more about the Derby? Read "No Limits" written by Matt Cot√©, via the link in our profile. The new Kendo 88 sets the tone for 50/50 frontside/backside skis with a new shape featuring V√∂lkl's revolutionary 3D Radius Sidecut design, and the proven Titanal Frame construction that first debuted on the M5 Mantra.  @voelklskis #simplyvolkl #weknowskiing #ad

Dreamer, pioneer, innovator, and the man with the best sunglasses in the game: Mike Wiegele. Watch the documentary now. @mikewiegeleheli @originoutside @thenorthface @hestragloves @atomicski @yellowhead.helicopters #ad

Tomorrow, @skipajarito in New Mexico will open for the season with 3 lifts spinning and some of the best early season conditions the mountain has seen in years. The skiing (and the food) in New Mexico is as unique as it gets, and certainly worth the journey for every skier at least once in a lifetime. Photo courtesy of Pajarito Mountain / @imagesmithphoto #SKImagazine
Nothing beats the feeling of being somewhere that doesn‚Äôt seem real. Seirus has the gear you need to reach places like this. üì∏ @grant_gunderson #ad

This mouth-watering image was shot in Alaska during the filming of Teton Gravity Research‚Äôs Winterland. Photographer Nic Alegre (@nicalegre) hovered above athlete Nick McNutt (@nickmcnutt) in a helicopter equipped with a gyro-stabilized camera as he ripped a line outside of Girdwood in a zone that the crew had come to call Slayer Bowl. ‚ÄúOur pilot had myself and cinematographer Jon Riley in perfect position, allowing us to attain the perspective we had hoped for,‚Äù Alegre says. ‚ÄúNick shredded it and it was definitely one of the highlights of this year‚Äôs first AK trip.‚Äù From the December 2019 issue of #SKImagazine

Ted Ligety (@ted_ligety) is one of the most decorated American male ski racers in history, but he is also so much more than a great skier. Learn about his life on and off the snow in the latest episode of @warrenmillerent's Long Underwear Podcast, hosted by @amieski. Check out the show notes and find out how to listen on multiple platforms via the link in our profile. Photo courtesy of the @usskiteam / @eric_schramm_photography #SKImagazine

At the @atomicski factory nestled in the Austrian Alps since 1955, it is clear that the people involved in the ski-building process‚Äîfrom the ground level to the brand‚Äôs highest-level designers‚Äîwere all invested in the same idea: Make the skiing experience better. #ad

Planning on traveling somewhere this week? Do your ears a favor and check out the Long Underwear Podcast from @warrenmillerent and @amieski. They just wrapped up the third season with a banger episode with the one and only @myshellparker, pictured here. Smash the link in our profile to listen to the latest episode and find out how to listen to more from every season while you're there. Photo courtesy of Warren Miller Entertainment and Michelle Parker. #SKImagazine

Last season at the @bcworldcup, skiers @dominikparis, @asvindal, and @akilde finished with the exact same 3rd-place time on the Super G course, putting 5 guys on the podium. What craziness will go down this weekend? We hope you're as excited as we are to find out. Don't miss the fastest men in the world take on @beavercreek this weekend, with the Super-G on Friday, Downhill on Saturday, and GS on Sunday. Photo credit: Erich Spiess/ ASP / @RedBull Content Pool #SKImagazine

Looking for a perfect last-minute gift? Check out Inside Edge, the premium membership package from #SKImagazine and @warrenmillerent. Membership includes a print subscription, exclusive member benefits, and access to even more great content from SKI and Warren Miller, like a story about the new @redmtnalpinelodge written by @kimberlyjaibeekman. Inside Edge is the perfect gift for every skier in your life, including yourself. Click the link in our bio to learn more. Photo courtesy of Red Mountain Alpine Lodge / Credit: @kanegallery

American @travisganong might be one of the fastest guys on the @fisalpine World Cup tour, but he can also shred pow better than most skiers, too. He recently got after it on his home mountain @squawalpine before flying off to Europe for another year with the @usskiteam. Good luck to him and all the American guys taking on Bormio this weekend! Video courtesy of @squawalpine #SKImagazine

We hope your New Years' Eve plans go down as smoothly as @dominikparis' downhill runs in Bormio last weekend (but maybe not as fast, 1 minute and 55.37 seconds is hardly enough time to celebrate the end of the decade). Catch up on all the Bormio results, plus the results of @mikaelashiffrin in Lienz, via the link in our bio. And Happy New Year from everyone at #SKImagazine! Photo courtesy of Erich Spiess/ASP/@RedBull Content Pool
Shop Talk 2020: Christian from @BlizzardSkis describes the new Black Pearl 82 women's ski from @skiTaos. To read more about this ski, check out the link in our bio. #SKImagazine
Mike from @FischerSki highlights the new Fischer Ranger 99 Ti during SKI Test at @skiTaos. Read about this ski via the link in our bio. #SKImagazine

The new Woodward Mountain Park at Mt. Bachelor, Ore., takes the sting out of park and pipe‚Äîand coaches you gently into a lifetime of joy. Check out the link in our bio to learn more about how you can improve your freestyle skills this season. #ad

Austin from @DynastarSkis highlights the new Intense 4x4 82 Pro and the SpeedZone 4x4 82 pro skis for 2020. Filmed on location during SKI Test at @SkiTaos. Read more about the Speed Zone 4x4 via the link in our profile. #SKImagazine

data.biography: The leading international media company in alpine skiing, providing expertise through informative writing, photography, and video.

perPostData.comment: It was an unbelievable ending to the North American segment of the World Cup tour üá∫üá∏. Tommy Ford captured his first win on home soil in commanding fashion, with a 0.80 margin over the second place finisher Henrik Kristofferson. üé•: @fisalpine #skiracing #fisalpine

NorAm racing may have wrapped up for 2019 last Friday but we have a full üì∏ recap of all the action to hold you over till the new year. Head to the link in our bio to check out the full gallery. #skiracing #fisalpine

She is BACK‚ùóÔ∏è Mikaela Shiffrin rebounded from her disappointment in Courchevel with an outstanding win today. The American grabbed the gold with a huge 1.36 second win margin over Marta Bassino of ItalyüèÜ. #skiracing #fisalpine

Race delays and snowstorms üå®couldn‚Äôt stop @esterledecka from picking up her first World Cup win today in Lake Louiseü•á. The women‚Äôs racing continues with another downhill tomorrow.  Full coverage is available on SkiRacing.com #skiracing #fisalpine

Nobody could touch @alexispinturault today as he won the Val d‚ÄôIsere slalom by a margin of 1.44 seconds over Sweden‚Äôs Andre Myhrer. The unexpected news of the day was USA‚Äôs @lukedwinters charging from bib 40 into 2Ô∏è‚É£nd place on the first run. Some issues in the second run would cause him to finish 19th.  Stay tuned for full race coverage on SkiRacing.com. #skiracing #fisalpine
Sofia Goggia grabbed her first Super-g gold in over a year todayü•á. The Italian shared the podium with her teammate Federica Brigone (+0.01) and Mikaela Shiffrin (+0.13). #skiracing #fisalpine

The Queen of Killington is back on the top step üëë. Mikaela Shiffrin took the win in today‚Äôs slalom with a HUGE margin, winning by 2.29 seconds over Petra Vlhova.  Anna Swenn-Larsson rounded out the podium in third. This was the 4th consecutive Killington win for the young American. #skiracing#fisalpine

This week on Tips and Tales we look back on a whirlwind three days of racing in Lake Louise and Beaver Creek.  What did this past weekend mean for those racers hunting for crystal globes? Hit the link in our bio to find out üéß #skiracing #fisalpine

It was all Petra Vlhova under the lights in Zagreb todayüèÜ. The Slovakian won both runs, taking the race by a substantial 1.31 second margin. Mikaela Shiffrin and Katharina Liensberger rounded out the podium in second and third respectively. #skiracing #fisalpine

It was a great ending to a wild World Cup weekend today, Mikaela Shiffrin grabbed the win in Lienz while Alexis Pinturault came back to take gold in the Bormio combined. Read all about the action in our latest premium articles through the links in our bio. #skiracing #fisalpine

We are still wrapping our heads around all the amazing racing that went down this weekendü§Ø. Check out full photo üì∏ galleries from both Lake Louise and Killington through the link in our bio. #skiracing #fisalpine

Petra Vlhova edged out Anna Swenn-Larsson for the win in the St. Moritz parallel slalom today.  Austria‚Äôs Franziska Gritsch rounded out the podium in third beating Slovenia‚Äôs Meta Hrovat in the small final. #skiracing #fisalpine

‚ÄúOn the evening of December 25, 2019, snowboarding lost one of the most colorful, charismatic, creative, talented, and authentic individuals to ever strap in and send it. The joy of the holidays has suddenly been juxtaposed with sadness with the news that Jaeger Bailey took his own life in Mammoth Lakes, California on Christmas Day. 
Seemingly from the moment his 2011 season edit dropped, Jaeger‚Äôs viral-ready trick regimen made his timelines required viewing for anyone looking to be dumbfounded, inspired, and entertained. Accomplishing Never Been Done‚Äôs was no big deal for Bailey, as he had an uncommon ability to flip on command, maintain board control while unstrapped, and handle kinks with confidence. While he competed in the X Games, both in Real Snow and in person, won rail jams like Hot Dawgz & Hand Rails, earned SNOWBOARDER‚Äôs Rookie of the Year award in 2013, and was featured in numerous films including The SNOWBOARDER Movie: Foreword and Think Thank‚Äôs Brain Dead Heart Attack, Jaeger is mostly remembered by the snowboarding masses for his endless stream of WTF moments, including but not limited to the Christ Air backflip, closeout hang-up frontflip, 540 erection plant, double-backie-to-knuckle-to-nollie-frontflip-out, and many, many, many more. Ultimately, Jaeger‚Äôs legacy in snowboarding looms larger than his 5‚Äô2‚Äù height, but for those who knew him personally, his good nature, wide smile and fearless style will be what we miss the most.‚Äù- #PatBridges 
From all of us at Snowboarder, we would like to thank Jaeger for all the laughs and good times. He will be deeply missed. We send our deepest condolences to Jaeger‚Äôs family and friends. üì∑: @mikeyoshida

#suzygreenberg270themovie from the mind of @sleepystevens is playing now on the site. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something special about the energy of Scott. Always has been. He‚Äôs got it. He blows minds while simultaneously inspiring people to try it for themselves. Scott is 100% about having fun with his crew, making his friends yell or laugh or just leaving them completely speechless. And really that‚Äôs why we do this stuff. Snowboard, skateboard, tramp board or whatever other freestylin‚Äô we get up to; it‚Äôs for the magical moments shared with friends. And for me (for years now) it‚Äôs often specifically for a Scott Stevens reaction. I know he‚Äôs going to love it if I get this trick and I‚Äôm going to love that he loves it. #SuzyGreenberg270The Movie had one goal, capture that energy. Tear the rule book up, if it pops it pops, energy is energy, fun is fun, sick is sick. Keep the camera rolling and hope for magical moments. What came out was a pure expression of Scott‚Äôs love for snowboarding, skateboarding and the cultures that surround them. No brand filter or other agenda, just Scott and friends and tricks and dogs and laughs. Very proud of him and of the whole crew that came together around this project, insane to think all these years later we have a full 45 minute long movie starring THE OG Massachusetts squad; Scott, @chris_grenier, @chris_beresford all together again, giving it their all. Plus me coming back for one more round in the ring and then layer on top of that some of Think Thank‚Äôs greatest hitters; Brandon Reis, Freddy Perry, Pika, Max Warbington, Geno and Phil Hansen along with endless newcomers like Matteo Soltane , Pat Fava etc. etc. and heavy cameos from Bode and JP and Chad O‚Ä¶.got a big smile on my face now just thinking about Scott standing at Woodward Copper filming Chad Otterstrom do a god damn double ‚Äúmisty‚Äù cork mctwist to fakie (off a hip), pan over to JOC with his mind blown. That‚Äôs beautiful! It‚Äôs been a real gift to be involved and now I just get to watch a movie with 100s of my friends being rad, I‚Äôll probably surf off this one for a good decade or so. Thanks Scott!‚Äù- @jesseburtner. Poster by @pika_burtner. Link in story. #snowboarding #snowboarder

"For the design of this @dakine_snowboarding jacket, I showed Peter [Line] a bunch of older jackets from the late 90s and early 2000s. I definitely had in mind the ones he was wearing in his Decade part, but I don't think I ever mentioned it, ha. The fabric is super light and flexible and makes it really comfortable to be active in it. The hood is removable, too, so you can put it away on a clear day or to wear in town."‚Äì @whatelze #SBDRNameDroppers live on the site now! #snowboarding #snowboarder

If you are in the market for a jacket that will stand up to the most brutal winter weather and then some, look no further than @thenorthface_snow Women‚Äôs A-CAD, part of TNF‚Äôs Steep Series. The A-CAD features The North Face‚Äôs brand new, proprietary FUTURELIGHT, touted as ‚Äúthe world‚Äôs most advanced breathable-waterproof technology developed using nanospinning technology and sustainable practices.‚Äù Full breakdown with @ecrosb87 @evo and @aspensnowmass from our latest #SBDRCoatcheck preview is live on the site now! #snowboarding #snowboarder

@volcomsnow‚Äôs Iris 3-in-1 GORE-TEX jacket is the latest #SBDRCoatCheck on the site now. An any-and-all conditions jacket that moves seamlessly throughout the entire winter season with three options for wear instead of one. The outer shell is made of highly waterproof and breathable 2-Layer Gore-Tex, the inner removable down sweater is made of 80/20 Responsive Down Standard Duck Down. Worn together, the combo is dually stormproof and insulated from the cold. Check out all the specs on the site now! Link in story. @evo @aspensnowmass #snowboarder #snowboarding

When it comes to selecting a jacket that is equal parts performance and cold weather cozy, the @dc_snowboarding Panoramic is at the top of our list for when the snow starts to fall. DC‚Äôs reputation for designing sharp, purposeful gear is visible in the understated, timeless style of parka-length Panoramic. Check out the stats above, more on the site. Filmed on location @aspensnowmass with @evo and @ecrosb87. #snowboarding #Snowboarder

@thenorthface Men‚Äôs A-CAD is lightweight, pliable, and extremely weatherproof. Unless you‚Äôve been in a state of pre-season hibernation, by this time you‚Äôve heard about The North Face‚Äôs all-new, proprietary tech, FUTURELIGHT. Touted by TNF as ‚Äúthe world‚Äôs most advanced breathable-waterproof outerwear technology developed using nanospinning technology and sustainable practices,‚Äù FUTURELIGHT was created in response to the real world needs of TNF‚Äôs roster of winter athletes and lucky for us, their preference for staying warm, dry, and agile is exactly the same as ours. Check out all the highlights in the new #SBDRCoatCheck on the site now! #snowboarding #snowboarder

perPostData.comment: @sleepystevens #SuzyGreenber270TheMovie is live! Link in bio! It‚Äôs always been a gift and üíØpercent joy to work with Scott. When he joined up with our little production company he altered our trajectory for the better in so many ways. All those years ago we schemed in making a ‚ÄúScott Stevens‚Äù movie but it wasn‚Äôt the right time and it had to come from Scott not be about Scott. This movie here is straight from Scott‚Äôs heart, he made it as only he could and it‚Äôs perfect. Proud of you Scott! Epic! @sleepystevens #thinkthank #thanksbrain

Meet @mrdavidwise
29 years old - Reno, NV
U.S. Freeski Halfpipe Team

Two-Time Olympic Gold Medalist David Wise has won six Grand Prixs, six World Cups, three X Games, and one Freeski World Championship in his skiing career. He originally tried ski racing, but after getting into trouble repeatedly for skiing the terrain park during racing practice, breaking expensive race skis on jumps and constantly nagging his parents, his parents finally let him try freeskiing. He is the only athlete to accomplish three-straight X Games wins since Tanner Hall‚Äôs three-peat from 2006-2008. At events, you can find his family cheering from the bottom of the pipe, and Malachi and Nayeli running out to give him a hug no matter his results.

SHE DID IT AGAIN‚ÄºÔ∏è 2.29 SECONDS?! @mikaelashiffrin WINS, grabbing the 4-peat on home snow at @killingtonmtn AND joins Austrian great Annemarie Moser-Pr√∂ll, tied for fourth on the all-time win list with 62 career victories!! üá∫üá∏üëèü•≥‚ö°Ô∏è#beast365 üì∏: @steveearl

And THIS is how @mikaelashiffrin (2Ô∏è‚É£nd) and @rc.s (6Ô∏è‚É£th) slayed to lead the @landroverusa U.S. Alpine Ski Team today. üî•‚ÄºÔ∏è

@mikaelashiffrin has podiumed in the last 15 consecutive World Cup slalom races, winning all but two of them. "This is how competition is supposed to be,‚Äù said Mikaela. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs pushing the limits, so then I‚Äôm pushing the limits and it‚Äôs raising the level of slalom skiing. VICTORY NO. 6Ô∏è‚É£4Ô∏è‚É£‚ÅâÔ∏è Get out the broom, because @mikaelashiffrin just swept #worldcuplienz, skiing out of her mind to beat @petravlhova13 by .61 seconds! (P.S. that‚Äôs a clean sweep, as she won ALL FOUR RUNS this weekend at Lienz.)üßπüßπ

Meet @LindseyJacobellis
34 years old - Stratton Mountain, Vt
U.S. Snowboardcross Team

Lindsey has been on the U.S. Snowboardcross Team for 18 years. She is arguably the most dominant snowboardcross athlete in the history of the sport. Not only because of her 30 SBX World Cup victories (plus one in halfpipe!), which is the most for any SBX athlete, male or female, but also because of her five World Championship titles, her Torino 2006 Olympic silver medal, two crystal globes and 10 snowboardcross titles at the X-Games. Since winning the very first race of her career back in 2003-04, the Californian only finished outside of the top-10 four times in 78 events and shows no signs of slowing down at age 34. During the offf-season, you can find Lindsey on the beach, playing the ukelele and riding waves in Cali. Lindsey is an inspirational leader and mentor for Super Girl Snow Pro, an event series dedicated to both showing the best female snowboarders and providing a platform for developmental athletes to get inspired.

@Maddie_Mastro vs Mother Nature ü•ä #feels #landrovergp

Meet @mickdorff 
28 years old - Steamboat Springs, CO
U.S. Snowboardcross Team

Mick started racing snowboardcross at only ten years old. Last season, he won the individual snowboardcross title at the FIS World Championships at Solitude Mountain Resort, becoming World Champion and also grabbing his first top-level international competition victory. He soon became a two-time World Champion when he and @lindseyjacobellis won the inaugural mixed team snowboardcross event. Mick is also the first AND youngest American to ever win a Nor-Am cup overall title. When he isn't strength training, Mick frames houses for a living. He also loves to camp, fish, hike, hunt, mountain bike and play golf!

Meet @Rosiemancari
25 years old - Anchorage, AK
U.S. Snowboardcross Team

Rosie grew up on the slopes of Alyeska Resort, just outside of Anchorage, Alaska and started riding when she was three years old! Rosie teamed up with @lindseyjacobellis in 2017 to win a world cup event at Solitude Mountain Resort. After an injury that prevented Rosie from competing in the 2018 Olympic Games, she is suspected to excel in the 2022 Games. She has recently returned to snow after 652 days off the boardercross track and is looking forward to a great season!

perPostData.comment: ‚ÄúOn your Route 100 journey, about 15 minutes south of Sugarbush, you enter the Granville Gulch. Oh. My God. The Granville Gulch is both stunning and narrow‚Äîslithering between steep hillsides and the iconic Mad River. Here and there, you‚Äôll see waterfalls so beautiful you‚Äôll cry...But you‚Äôll need help once your tears of joy dry. So here‚Äôs a collection of tips that‚Äôll help you properly experience Sugarbush and the wonderfully unique Mad River Valley to the fullest.‚Äù Read what east coast-based writer and skier @connor_w_davis has up his sleeve for visiting @sugarbush_vt Resort this winter. perPostData.comment:
Full video on our Facebook Page: The 900 was first landed on a skateboard 20 years ago (at X Games, of course). The trick remains so difficult that fewer than 10 people have done it at #XGames. Then came the 1080; you can count the people who have landed that trick on one hand. Now we have the 1260.

#MitchieBrusco landed the world‚Äôs first 1260 on the quarterpipe during Run 3 of Skateboard Big Air. He crashed attempting the trick in his first two runs, and that came after crashing on it twice at X Games Shanghai. He made it look easy in his 5th overall attempt at X Games. The 1260 was part of a line that included a switch 180 over the 50-ft. gap. Despite the world‚Äôs first 1260, Mitchie took silver. 
He now owns 10 X Games medals total. And 1260 bragging rights.

Full video on our Facebook Page: Are you kidding? The man does 12 chemo treatments in six months, is only two months removed from his final treatment in late August, spends just a week on snow and then beats the best in the world at XG Norway? Beautiful.

Norway 2019 gold was #MaxParrot‚Äôs 5th title in Snowboard Big Air. No other man or woman has more than 3. He has the most #Snowboard Big Air medals in X Games history (8). His 5 gold and 8 medals are both tied with skier Henrik Harlaut for most in either #XGames Ski or SBD. Max now has 6 total X Games gold and 10 medals overall.

Just a reminder: THE MAN SPENT THE YEAR FIGHTING CANCER. This is the best story of 2019, and @brando_graham and @craigmcmorris‚Äô call on Max‚Äôs final run was great.

Full Video on our Facebook Page: In a fantastic comp that featured six scores of 90 or above, perhaps the best competitive slopestyle athlete ever saved his best for last. #MarkMcMorris sat in 2nd after Run 1 with a strong 89.66. By the time he dropped in for his last run -- the very last run of the entire contest -- he was down in 5th. But McMo loves pressure and is a contest killer, and he laid down an incredible pass that scored a 96, edging the surprising @renerinnekangas (who knew he was beat but was just so stoked to be there) for the dramatic walk-off win.

The entire run was great, the jump line: switch backside 1260 stalefish, frontside triple cork 1440 mute, backside triple cork 1620 mute. Can‚Äôt beat the call, either, featuring analyst @craigmcmorris shouting, ‚ÄúTouchdown, Saskatchewan!‚Äù Slopestyle gold was Mark‚Äôs 5th in the discipline, tying @shaunwhite‚Äôs decade-old X Games mark. McMorris now has 10 Slopestyle medals total, most in history. His 17 X Games medals overall equals Joe Parsons for second-most XG winter discipline podiums, one behind White.

Full video on our Facebook Page: Another world‚Äôs first! No one ever had landed a backflip body varial until the unheralded Frenchman did it in Run 1 of Moto X Best Trick. He earned gold. Of course.

Full Video on our Facebook Page: In a fantastic comp that featured six scores of 90 or above, perhaps the best competitive slopestyle athlete ever saved his best for last. #MarkMcMorris sat in 2nd after Run 1 with a strong 89.66. By the time he dropped in for his last run -- the very last run of the entire contest -- he was down in 5th. But McMo loves pressure and is a contest killer, and he laid down an incredible pass that scored a 96, edging the surprising @renerinnekangas (who knew he was beat but was just so stoked to be there) for the dramatic walk-off win.

The entire run was great, the jump line: switch backside 1260 stalefish, frontside triple cork 1440 mute, backside triple cork 1620 mute. Can‚Äôt beat the call, either, featuring analyst @craigmcmorris shouting, ‚ÄúTouchdown, Saskatchewan!‚Äù Slopestyle gold was Mark‚Äôs 5th in the discipline, tying @shaunwhite‚Äôs decade-old X Games mark. McMorris now has 10 Slopestyle medals total, most in history. His 17 X Games medals overall equals Joe Parsons for second-most XG winter discipline podiums, one behind White.

Happy holidays from our X Games family and of course, @travelindan! üéÖ
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üì∏: @_dmc_creative_

Full video on our Facebook Page: The 900 was first landed on a skateboard 20 years ago (at X Games, of course). The trick remains so difficult that fewer than 10 people have done it at #XGames. Then came the 1080; you can count the people who have landed that trick on one hand. Now we have the 1260.

#MitchieBrusco landed the world‚Äôs first 1260 on the quarterpipe during Run 3 of Skateboard Big Air. He crashed attempting the trick in his first two runs, and that came after crashing on it twice at X Games Shanghai. He made it look easy in his 5th overall attempt at X Games. The 1260 was part of a line that included a switch 180 over the 50-ft. gap. Despite the world‚Äôs first 1260, Mitchie took silver. 
He now owns 10 X Games medals total. And 1260 bragging rights.

Full video on our Facebook Page: Are you kidding? The man does 12 chemo treatments in six months, is only two months removed from his final treatment in late August, spends just a week on snow and then beats the best in the world at XG Norway? Beautiful.

Norway 2019 gold was #MaxParrot‚Äôs 5th title in Snowboard Big Air. No other man or woman has more than 3. He has the most #Snowboard Big Air medals in X Games history (8). His 5 gold and 8 medals are both tied with skier Henrik Harlaut for most in either #XGames Ski or SBD. Max now has 6 total X Games gold and 10 medals overall.

Just a reminder: THE MAN SPENT THE YEAR FIGHTING CANCER. This is the best story of 2019, and @brando_graham and @craigmcmorris‚Äô call on Max‚Äôs final run was great.
